Instance.description: Tuning that holds style data for Situations.

TunableVariant.name: cas_edit_job
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, shows up to two Sims from a specific job and allows taking them in to CAS.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The job to show in the UI and the outfit category the Sim should be shown in.

Tunable.name: job
Tunable.description: This is the Situation Job that can be edited in CAS. Currently, the UI only supports up to 2 Sims in this job.

Tunable.name: no_sim_selected_icon
Tunable.description: The icon to show in place of a Sim if no Sim has been selected for the tuned Job.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_category
TunableEnum.description: The outfit the Sim will wear in the UI. This is also the outfit that will be targeted when in CAS.

Tunable.name: visible_on_role_page
Tunable.description: If enabled, the Outfit Selector will be visible on the Guest Invite panel for the situation.

TunableVariant.name: customizable_guest_attire
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows customizing the guest attire for a Situation.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Color and Style tuning for the guest attire.

TunableVariant.name: appearance_modifier
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will show a checkbox in the attire selection panel, to be able to apply an appearance modifier. If selected, it applies an appearance modifier to the guests. The color picked by the player is also applied to this appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Options for the appearance modifier.

Tunable.name: checkbox_text
Tunable.description: The text that shows in the checkbox.

TunableTuple.name: modifier
TunableTuple.description: The appearance modifier to apply to the guests.

TunableList.name: additional_flags
TunableList.description: Additional flags that will be sent as part of this outfit override. Note, ignore_bathing is only valid if apply_to_all_outfits is also checked.

TunableList.name: appearance_modifiers
TunableList.description: The specific appearance modifiers to use for this buff.
A tunable list of weighted modifiers. When applying modifiers one of the modifiers in this list will be applied. The weight will be used to run a weighted random selection.

TunableTuple.description: A Modifier to apply and weight for the weighted random selection.

TunableTuple.name: generate_outfit
TunableTuple.description: Generates an outfit using the Sim's current outfits to pull from. Note: Be sure to supply Body Type Flags either in the chance overrides or match not found policy. Otherwise, we use CLOTHING ALL. If you don't specify which flags you intend to use, it's possible the generator may have undefined behavior. Use flags if you intend on changing known cas part types on the Sim.

Tunable.name: _is_combinable_with_same_type
Tunable.description: True if this modifier type is able to be combined with another of its type. If True, and two modifiers conflict, then the tuned priority will be used to resolve the conflict. If False, only a single modifier of this type with the highest priority will be shown.

TunableVariant.name: appearance_modifier_tag
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a tag used to reference this appearance modifier.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Tag associated with this appearance modifier.

Tunable.name: apply_before_other_modifiers
Tunable.description: When True then this will be applied before any other modifiers on the Sim. When this is False we won't move this to the front of the modifiers allowing for this to appear above other modifiers like SetCASPart for example. This was added so that the costume box costumes would apply over club costumes.

TunableTuple.name: outfit_generator
TunableTuple.description: Inputs to generate the type of outfit we want.

TunableList.name: blocked_tags
TunableList.description: The set of prohibited tags used to generate the outfit. Parts must not match the specified tag in order to be valid for the generated outfit.

TunableList.name: body_type_chance_overrides
TunableList.description: Define body type chance overrides for the generate outfit. For example, if BODYTYPE_HAT is mapped to 100%, then the outfit is guaranteed to have a hat if any hat matches the specified tags. If used in an appearance modifier, these body types will contribute to the flags that determine which body types can be generated, regardless of their percent chance.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The chance that a part is applied to the corresponding body type.

TunableList.name: body_type_match_not_found_policy
TunableList.display: Body Type Match Not Found Policy
TunableList.description: The policy we should take for a body type that we fail to find a match for. Primary example is to use MATCH_NOT_FOUND_KEEP_EXISTING for generating a tshirt and making sure a sim wearing full body has a lower body cas part. If used in an appearance modifier, these body types will contribute to the flags that determine which body types can be generated.

TunableList.name: filter_flag
TunableList.description: Define how to handle part randomization for the generated outfit.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The set of tags used to generate the outfit. Parts must match the specified tag in order to be valid for the generated outfit.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will generate the outfit on the tuned outfit category and index. Otherwise, we use the Sim's current outfit in the generator.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The outfit category we want to generate the outfit on.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_type_compatibility
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will verify when switching outfits if the new outfit is compatible with this appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The outfit category must match the whitelist and blacklist to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableEnum.description: The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.
The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

Tunable.name: should_refresh_thumbnail
Tunable.description: Whether or not this modifier should trigger a skewer thumbnail refresh. e.g. if it changes anything from shoulders and up.

TunableTuple.name: randomize_body_type_color
TunableTuple.description: Randomizes the color of the tuned body type.

Tunable.name: _is_combinable_with_same_type
Tunable.description: True if this modifier type is able to be combined with another of its type. If True, and two modifiers conflict, then the tuned priority will be used to resolve the conflict. If False, only a single modifier of this type with the highest priority will be shown.

TunableVariant.name: appearance_modifier_tag
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a tag used to reference this appearance modifier.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Tag associated with this appearance modifier.

TunableEnum.name: body_type
TunableEnum.description: The body type that will have its color randomized.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_type_compatibility
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will verify when switching outfits if the new outfit is compatible with this appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.description: The outfit category must match the whitelist and blacklist to be applied.

The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

Tunable.name: should_refresh_thumbnail
Tunable.description: Whether or not this modifier should trigger a skewer thumbnail refresh. e.g. if it changes anything from shoulders and up.

TunableTuple.name: randomize_cas_part
TunableTuple.description: Randomizes a CAS part for the tuned body type. Use tags from the existing CAS part that belong to the tuned tag categories.

Tunable.name: _is_combinable_with_same_type

TunableList.name: tag_categories_to_keep
TunableList.description: Match tags from the existing CAS part of the specified body type that belong to these tag categories when searching for a new random part.

TunableEnum.description: Tags that belong to this category that are on the existing CAS part of the specified body type will be used to find a new random part.
List of tags to use when randomizing a CAS part for the tuned body type.

TunableTuple.name: randomize_skintone_between_tags
TunableTuple.description: Picks a random skintone, from between sets of skintones determined by the tuned tags.

Tunable.name: update_genetics
Tunable.description: Whether or not to update the genetics of the sim with this modification to make it a permanent modification. NOTE: DO NOT tune permanent with temporary modifications on the same appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.name: remove_cas_part_by_body_type
TunableTuple.display: Remove Cas Part By Body Type

Tunable.name: remove_custom_textures

Tunable.name: update_genetics

TunableTuple.name: replace_cas_part
TunableTuple.description: Replaces CAS part on the sim based on a mapping. Also has an option to set a CAS part if no part is replaced based on the mapping.

Tunable.name: _is_combinable_with_same_type
Tunable.description: True if this modifier type is able to be combined with another of its type. If True, and two modifiers conflict, then the tuned priority will be used to resolve the conflict. If False, only a single modifier of this type with the highest priority will be shown.

TunableVariant.name: appearance_modifier_tag
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a tag used to reference this appearance modifier.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Tag associated with this appearance modifier.

TunableVariant.name: default_set_part
TunableVariant.description: If set, this CAS part will be set if no parts are replaced with the previous mapping. When 'Fallback To Map Values' is chosen, if one of the parts in the Replace Part Map's values is already on the sim, re-apply it.

Tunable.name: specific_part
Tunable.description: The CAS part that will be modified. This doesn't take into account what has already been set on the sim.

Tunable.name: expect_invalid_parts
Tunable.description: Whether or not parts that are invalid for a sim should log an error. If we are expecting invalid parts, (say, buff gives one part that applies to adults and a different part for children,) then we should set this to True so that it doesn't throw the error when it tries to apply the adult part on the child and vice versa.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_type_compatibility
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will verify when switching outfits if the new outfit is compatible with this appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The outfit category must match the whitelist and blacklist to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist

The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

TunableList.name: replace_part_map
TunableList.description: The CAS part (value) that will replace another CAS part (key) if sim has that equipped. It currently only replaces the first one which it finds. Nothing will be replaced if the sim doesn't have any of the key CAS parts set.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: CAS part to look up.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: If key CAS part is set, replace it with this CAS part.

Tunable.name: should_refresh_thumbnail
Tunable.description: Whether or not this modifier should trigger a skewer thumbnail refresh. e.g. if it changes anything from shoulders and up.

Tunable.name: update_genetics
Tunable.description: Whether or not to update the genetics of the sim with this modification to make it a permanent modification. NOTE: DO NOT tune permanent with temporary modifications on the same appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.name: set_cas_part
TunableTuple.description: Sets the tuned CAS part. Also has an option to toggle the existence of the tuned CAS part.

Tunable.name: _is_combinable_with_same_type
Tunable.description: True if this modifier type is able to be combined with another of its type. If True, and two modifiers conflict, then the tuned priority will be used to resolve the conflict. If False, only a single modifier of this type with the highest priority will be shown.

TunableVariant.name: appearance_modifier_tag
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a tag used to reference this appearance modifier.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Tag associated with this appearance modifier.

Tunable.name: cas_part
Tunable.description: The CAS part that will be modified.

Tunable.name: expect_invalid_parts
Tunable.description: Whether or not parts that are invalid for a sim should log an error. If we are expecting invalid parts, (say, buff gives one part that applies to adults and a different part for children,) then we should set this to True so that it doesn't throw the error when it tries to apply the adult part on the child and vice versa.

TunableVariant.name: hsv_color_shift
TunableVariant.description: HSV color shift to apply (This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Color tuning snippet.)

TunableVariant.name: apply_new_value
TunableVariant.description: HSV color shift to apply (This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Color tuning snippet.)

TunableVariant.name: literal
TunableVariant.description: A color.

TunableTuple.name: hex
TunableTuple.description: A color.

Tunable.name: hex_code
Tunable.description: An ARGB color in hex, same as one would use in HTML. A leading '0x' or '#' is allowed but not required. You can omit the alpha, in which case opaque is assumed.

TunableTuple.name: rgb
TunableTuple.description: A color.

Tunable.name: a
Tunable.description: alpha value (0-255) (0 is transparent, 255 is opaque)

Tunable.name: b
Tunable.description: blue value (0-255)

Tunable.name: g
Tunable.description: green value (0-255)

Tunable.name: r
Tunable.description: red value (0-255)

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a Color tuning snippet.

TunableVariant.name: object_id
TunableVariant.description: If defined, value to be stored in Part when setting the part

TunableVariant.name: outfit_type_compatibility
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will verify when switching outfits if the new outfit is compatible with this appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The outfit category must match the whitelist and blacklist to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableEnum.description: The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.
The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

Tunable.name: part_layer_index
Tunable.description: Layer in which the item will be applied. If value is greater than 0, CAS part must be stackable for this to work

Tunable.name: remove_conflicting
Tunable.description: If checked, conflicting parts are removed from the outfit. For instance, a full body outfit might be removed if a part would conflict with it. e.g. The Cone of Shame removes conflicting full-body pet outfits.

Tunable.name: replace_with_random
Tunable.description: Whether or not to replace the tuned cas part with a random variant.

TunableVariant.name: rgba_color_shift
TunableVariant.description: RGBA Color shift to apply. If set, the HSV color shift will be ignored.

Tunable.name: should_refresh_thumbnail
Tunable.description: Whether or not this modifier should trigger a skewer thumbnail refresh. e.g. if it changes anything from shoulders and up.

Tunable.name: should_toggle
Tunable.description: Whether or not to toggle this part. e.g. if it exists, remove it, if it doesn't exist, add it. If set to false, the part will be added if it doesn't exist, but not removed if it does exist.

Tunable.name: update_genetics
Tunable.description: Whether or not to update the genetics of the sim with this modification to make it a permanent modification. NOTE: DO NOT tune permanent with temporary modifications on the same appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.name: set_sim_attachment_part
TunableTuple.description: Sets the tuned Sim attachment CAS part.

Tunable.name: _is_combinable_with_same_type
Tunable.description: True if this modifier type is able to be combined with another of its type. If True, and two modifiers conflict, then the tuned priority will be used to resolve the conflict. If False, only a single modifier of this type with the highest priority will be shown.

TunableVariant.name: appearance_modifier_tag
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a tag used to reference this appearance modifier.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Tag associated with this appearance modifier.

TunableVariant.name: attachment_part_option
TunableVariant.description: Different ways to select the attachment part.

TunableTuple.name: cas_object_definition
TunableTuple.description: Select the attachment part by object definition.

Tunable.name: attachment_part
Tunable.description: The sim attachment part that will be applied.

TunableTuple.name: trait_to_object
TunableTuple.description: Select the attachment part by 'trait - object definition' map.

TunableList.name: trait_sets_to_test_map
TunableList.description: These traits are tested to the primary sim to select from a subset of options based on the secondary sim.

TunableTuple.description: A (trait, set of pairs) pair.

TunableList.name: attachment_list
TunableList.description: These pairs are the final CAS object based on the trait the carried sim has.

TunableTuple.description: A (trait, attachment part) pair.

Tunable.name: attachment_part
Tunable.description: The sim attachment part that will be applied.

Tunable.name: trait
Tunable.description: Trait the secondary sim must have for this attachment to be able to attach to them.

Tunable.name: trait
Tunable.description: Trait the sim must have to further check the following traits.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_type_compatibility
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will verify when switching outfits if the new outfit is compatible with this appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The outfit category must match the whitelist and blacklist to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableEnum.description: The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.
The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

Tunable.name: should_refresh_thumbnail
Tunable.description: Whether or not this modifier should trigger a skewer thumbnail refresh. e.g. if it changes anything from shoulders and up.

TunableTuple.name: set_wing_attachment_part
TunableTuple.description: Attaches the wings to a fairy sim.

Tunable.name: _is_combinable_with_same_type
Tunable.description: True if this modifier type is able to be combined with another of its type. If True, and two modifiers conflict, then the tuned priority will be used to resolve the conflict. If False, only a single modifier of this type with the highest priority will be shown.

TunableVariant.name: appearance_modifier_tag
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a tag used to reference this appearance modifier.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Tag associated with this appearance modifier.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_type_compatibility
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will verify when switching outfits if the new outfit is compatible with this appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The outfit category must match the whitelist and blacklist to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableEnum.description: The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.
The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

Tunable.name: should_refresh_thumbnail
Tunable.description: Whether or not this modifier should trigger a skewer thumbnail refresh. e.g. if it changes anything from shoulders and up.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A weight with testable multipliers that is used to determine how likely this entry is to be picked when selecting randomly.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: apply_to_all_outfits
Tunable.description: If checked, the appearance modifiers will be applied to all outfits, otherwise they will only be applied to the current outfit.

TunableEnum.name: priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of the appearance request. Higher priority will take precedence over lower priority. Equal priority will favor recent requests.

TunableList.name: color_map
TunableList.description: A mapping from CAS tags to LocalizedStrings representing available colors for Situation guest attire.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: A color tag used to find matching CAS parts for the Guests.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The name and hex value for the color.

Tunable.name: color_name
Tunable.description: The name of the Color.

Tunable.name: color_value
Tunable.description: The hex value of the color.

TunableList.name: style_map
TunableList.description: A mapping from CAS tags to LocalizedStrings shown in the Situation Creation UI for choosing attire style.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The style tag of the CAS parts associated with this style.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The display name for this style. Shown in a dropdown in the Situation Creation UI.

Tunable.name: visible_on_role_page
Tunable.description: If enabled, the GuestAttireSelector will be visible on the Guest Invite panel for the situation.
